document.title: These are the AQA GCSE Physics specification points

436BE3E368AC45CCB4C44E2E05563CDC.description: Calculate areas of triangles and rectangles, surface areas and volumes of cubes

7B289ADF5E9648CA8E1EDD2FB1AB6FAD.description:
Visualise and represent 2D and 3D forms including two dimensional representations of 3D
objects

1DAA5E2D64CE45F4A93381148A6D22AB.description:
Understand the physical significance of area between a curve and the x-axis and measure it
by counting squares as appropriate

9788737E36244B71B76372474BBA9212.description: Draw and use the slope of a tangent to a curve as a measure of rate of change

4928F231655B420DA2A9576E408D680E.description: Determine the slope and intercept of a linear graph

48872E064CB24C978FD96606E5157BC4.description: Plot two variables from experimental or other data

A3D2AC66F1B14A8FB19F83127BFE32E0.description: Understand that y = mx + c represents a linear relationship

F2881C5F988C4160A4CEE4E4C0C7B122.description: Translate information between graphical and numeric form

AE2609F5D2C64CCBAEC2DC53F94D8166.description:
Substitute numerical values into algebraic equations using appropriate units for physical
quantities

DF3CD0427ED4486EAA01308A51FFB611.description: Change the subject of an equation

6DCD2ED156124DF4A30DF7857DA7CDA5.description: Use a scatter diagram to identify a correlation between two variables

C08AB4A65A144033A08014759AC8EE79.description: Understand the terms mean, mode and median

02F9A4754641497CBACF90A58139850B.description: Construct and interpret frequency tables and diagrams, bar charts and histograms

FCB66FF099744BA4AE3F64A25019D12A.description: Use an appropriate number of significant figures

3EB1EDF43EA8468DA59B128C3CF12040.description: Make estimates of the results of simple calculations

93EEDE1CE95749E1917B7EFBE1D65B61.description: Recognise and use expressions in standard form

F23DDB99109347EA91A1E8BF2BD029A8.description: Recognise and use expressions in decimal form

64FEBCBF73E942FEA3A5570741AF33B3.description:
AO3: Analyse information and ideas to: interpret and evaluate; make judgments and draw
conclusions; develop and improve experimental procedures.

44D0AC0D74D7499395FC8A4B03A1A36A.description:
AO2: Apply knowledge and understanding of: scientific ideas; scientific enquiry, techniques
and procedures.

D4FC6DABAD04413C9B535A03C3A07C50.description:
AO1: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of: scientific ideas; scientific techniques
and procedures.

32611F3E98B34605BB2848AEDE35BA0E.description: Orbital motion, natural and artifical satellites

22B991A9D7C3412CB89A7D594CA3227A.description: The life cycle of a star

238BA2C5861F42C48305602A0F7AFB30.description: Solar system; stability of orbital motions; satellites

50CF1E72A4024E5C81B90E20841A5C63.description: Induced potential, transformers and the National Grid

19A3D519DD1141129D04F5586A2B19AB.description: Permanent and induced magnetism, magnetic forces and fields

914C59D7E459414B967DDBA8F5D9EBA8.description: Emission and absorption of infrared radiation

D440C51C6F8644A083E7765EBF10891B.description: Uses and applications of electromagnetic waves

B9B5CF49C0A94049ADFFE013C943A002.description: Waves in air, fluids and solids

CBD47DEA4D3F49919497608BFDB49ECE.description: Momentum is a property of moving objects

82CA20A1838B43E099ABD696CD3ADDA2.description: Forces, accelerations and Newton's Laws of motion

3B1DB81D11224FBC99ABA4ED47777E4B.description: Pressure and pressure differences in fluids

F05312AD6EBA428498EE21C26440C5E1.description: Hazards and uses of radioactive emissions and of background radiation

BB5033D4DF5D42779139F39BDD937266.description: Half-lives and the random nature of radioactive decay

D6D6A0D29BAB44B1AAC962CE7D94B543.description: The development of the model of the atom

D1FFD50BED8742F39FF3D5D8021813E1.description: Mass number, atomic number and isotopes

A831727798454D13864E2922B262C697.description: Increasing the pressure of a gas

FACC9C457E10494783A6A5EC421CD28C.description: Changes of state and specific latent heat

1870E1F9507A4449AFEFC82CFCC300DB.description: Temperature changes in a system and specific heat capacity

F3F274DDDF414192AF94499DDE142AFA.description: Changes of state and the particle model

CF9CA3B68CE944108CA68BC040342D38.description:
Energy changes in a system, and the ways energy is stored
before and after such changes

021DFE1C8773427EAA6C1BBE4ADFE688.description:
Use an appropriate number of
significant figures in calculation.

52E67C4015884F2F9FA34808BABB604F.description:
Use prefixes and powers of ten for
orders of magnitude (eg tera, giga, mega, kilo,
centi, milli, micro and nano).

C995B4F5EB8A424F9F5D144DABA2BF9C.description:
Recognise the importance of scientific
quantities and understand how they are
determined.

803538A6A5F844E2AF528FD0290AACA4.description:
Use scientific vocabulary, terminology
and definitions.

F35DF187D1B24B3791150DBA3C95210B.description: WS4 Scientific vocabulary, quantities, units, symbols and nomenclature

513A63946068480ABDB96790DCABBE93.description:
Communicating the scientific rationale
for investigations, methods used, findings and
reasoned conclusions through paper-based and
electronic reports and presentations using
verbal, diagrammatic, graphical, numerical and
symbolic forms.

C80E1E8980434C61B3FE1CCEDBB2383B.description:
Being objective, evaluating data in
terms of accuracy, precision, repeatability and
reproducibility and identifying potential sources
of random and systematic error.

E01E4DF889BF4938BC3BE45E8C038B4E.description:
Presenting reasoned explanations
including relating data to hypotheses.

04E9E867C28B488BA6E2A1E0ED22F0EB.description:
Interpreting observations and other
data (presented in verbal, diagrammatic,
graphical, symbolic or numerical form),
including identifying patterns and trends,
making inferences and drawing conclusions

81F0C482BA074C31B661DBB8CE8C36C2.description:
Representing distributions of results
and make estimations of uncertainty.

6CA0B37A2E644C0690A2CDD14B9D53F9.description:
Carrying out and represent
mathematical and statistical analysis.

51ACB8303C114147B4A18275A0EEDB5A.description:
Translating data from one form to
another.

E268F5E0C0BE465A99261F5A95C53E70.description:
Presenting observations and other data
using appropriate methods.

CE7E197F7B104CA685209B1E6808C827.description:
Evaluate methods and suggest possible
improvements and further investigations.

145643A3A2844E76B4FD6AC881934CA6.description:
Make and record observations and
measurements using a range of apparatus and
methods.

62A6735EECAD492BB42DF8CA45A87B0A.description:
Recognise when to apply a knowledge
of sampling techniques to ensure any samples
collected are representative.

23AB6ACA720049A2A260BF9B6080700B.description:
Carry out experiments appropriately
having due regard for the correct manipulation
of apparatus, the accuracy of measurements
and health and safety considerations.

D26BB23D7C114DDDBB956055AC40CAC0.description:
Apply a knowledge of a range of
techniques, instruments, apparatus, and
materials to select those appropriate to the
experiment.

02529C0FEBD84FA9B4D0BDE8136B96FA.description:
Plan experiments or devise procedures
to make observations, produce or characterise
a substance, test hypotheses, check data or
explore phenomena.

07B01624F84E4959BD9ABC7D34799001.description:
Use scientific theories and explanations
to develop hypotheses.

1C74AF05C98C465E8E5B7FE2A30496AC.description:
Recognise the importance of peer
review of results and of communicating results
to a range of audiences.

C51DB149F7C147618E93C1FF278F3468.description:
Evaluate risks both in practical science
and the wider societal context, including
perception of risk in relation to data and
consequences.

56EB068A8A6D4E2583AE0B9A6579A035.description:
Explain everyday and technological
applications of science; evaluate associated
personal, social, economic and environmental
implications; and make decisions based on the
evaluation of evidence and arguments.

682BE71506A04A28BAD910E38A0EFA88.description:
Appreciate the power and limitations of
science and consider any ethical issues which
may arise.

DD8F71695D354D8688DCA76A68200471.description:
Use a variety of models such as
representational, spatial, descriptive,
computational and mathematical to solve
problems, make predictions and to develop
scientific explanations and understanding of
familiar and unfamiliar facts.

40519001024147D3871E3276BA4B5A32.description:
Understand how scientific methods and
theories develop over time.
